elements.desc:
`` is a single-line text field with Material Design styling. It may include an optional error message or character counter. It can also include custom prefix or suffix elements, which are displayed before or after the text input itself. In order for an element to be considered as a prefix, it must have the `prefix` attribute (and similarly for `suffix`).
$
 A `paper-input` can use the native `type=search` features. However, since we can't control the native styling of the input, it's recommended to use a placeholder text, or `always-float-label`, as to not overlap the native search icon. See `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` for more API docs. ### Styling See `Polymer.PaperInputContainer` for a list of custom properties used to style this element.

properties.name: allowedPattern
properties.desc:
Set this to specify the pattern allowed by `preventInvalidInput`. Bind this to the
`<input is="iron-input">`'s `allowedPattern` property.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.desc:
Set to true to always float the label. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`alwaysFloatLabel` property.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocapitalize` property.

properties.name: autosave

properties.name: autoValidate
properties.desc:
Set to true to auto-validate the input value. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`autoValidate` property.

properties.name: charCounter
properties.desc: Set to true to show a character counter.

properties.name: disabled
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable this input. Bind this to both the `<paper-input-container>`'s
and the input's `disabled` property.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.desc:
The error message to display when the input is invalid. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-error>`'s content, if using.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: inputElement
properties.desc: Returns a reference to the input element.

properties.name: inputmode
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `inputmode` property.

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc:
Returns true if the value is invalid. Bind this to both the `<paper-input-container>`'s
and the input's `invalid` property.

properties.name: label
properties.desc: The label for this input. Bind this to `<paper-input-container>`'s `label` property.

properties.name: list
properties.desc:
The datalist of the input (if any). This should match the id of an existing <datalist>. Bind this
to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `list` property.

properties.name: max
properties.desc:
The maximum (numeric or date-time) input value.
Can be a String (e.g. `"2000-1-1"`) or a Number (e.g. `2`).
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `max` property.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.desc:
The maximum length of the input value. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s
`maxlength` property.

properties.name: min
properties.desc:
The minimum (numeric or date-time) input value.
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `min` property.

properties.name: minlength
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `minlength` property.

properties.name: name
properties.desc: The name of this element.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable the floating label. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`noLabelFloat` property.

properties.name: pattern
properties.desc:
A pattern to validate the `input` with. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s
`pattern` property.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.desc: A placeholder string in addition to the label. If this is set, the label will always float.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.desc:
Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input. Bind this to the
`<input is="iron-input">`'s `preventInvalidInput` property.

properties.name: readonly
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `readonly` property.

properties.name: required
properties.desc:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recomended to provide a visual style for the element
when it's value is invalid.

properties.name: results
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `results` property, , used with type=search.

properties.name: size
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `size` property.

properties.name: step
properties.desc:
Limits the numeric or date-time increments.
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `step` property.

properties.name: type
properties.desc:
The type of the input. The supported types are `text`, `number` and `password`. Bind this
to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `type` property.

properties.name: updateValueAndPreserveCaret
properties.desc: Restores the cursor to its original position after updating the value.

params.name: newValue
params.desc: The value that should be saved.

properties.desc: Validates the input element and sets an error style if needed.

property.

properties.name: _parentForm
properties.desc: The form that the element is registered to.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.desc: Set to true to always float the floating label.

properties.name: attrForValue

properties.name: autoValidate
properties.desc: Set to true to auto-validate the input value when it changes.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: True if the input has focus.

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc:
True if the input is invalid. This property is set automatically when the input value
changes if auto-validating, or when the `iron-input-validate` event is heard from a child.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable the floating label. The label disappears when the input value is
not null.

properties.name: updateAddons
properties.desc: Call this to update the state of add-ons.

properties.name: _inputHasContent
properties.desc: in polyfill.

elements.desc:
`<paper-input-error>` is an error message for use with `<paper-input-container>`. The error is
displayed when the `<paper-input-container>` is `invalid`.

    <paper-input-container>
      <input is="iron-input" pattern="[0-9]*">
      <paper-input-error>Only numbers are allowed!</paper-input-error>
    </paper-input-container>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-input-container-invalid-color` | The foreground color of the error | `--google-red-500`
`--paper-input-error`                   | Mixin applied to the error        | `{}`

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc: True if the error is showing.

elements.desc:
`<paper-input-char-counter>` is a character counter for use with `<paper-input-container>`. It
shows the number of characters entered in the input and the max length if it is specified.

    <paper-input-container>
      <input is="iron-input" maxlength="20">
      <paper-input-char-counter></paper-input-char-counter>
    </paper-input-container>

### Styling

The following mixin is available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-input-char-counter` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`

`<paper-textarea>` is a multi-line text field with Material Design styling.

    <paper-textarea label="Textarea label"></paper-textarea>

See `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` for more API docs.

### Validation

Currently only `required` and `maxlength` validation is supported.

### Styling

See `Polymer.PaperInputContainer` for a list of custom properties used to
style this element.

behaviors.desc:
Use `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` to implement inputs with `<paper-input-container>`. This
behavior is implemented by `<paper-input>`. It exposes a number of properties from
`<paper-input-container>` and `<input is="iron-input">` and they should be bound in your
template.

The input element can be accessed by the `inputElement` property if you need to access
properties or methods that are not exposed.

events.desc: Fired when the input changes due to user interaction.

The input element can be accessed by the `inputElement` property if you need to access

properties.name: updateValueAndPreserveCaret
properties.desc: Restores the cursor to its original position after updating the value.

trailingComments.value: The cursor automatically jumps to the end after re-setting the value,
so restore it to its original position.

leadingComments.value: The cursor automatically jumps to the end after re-setting the value,
so restore it to its original position.
Just set the value and give up on the caret.
Not all elements might have selection, and even if they have the
right properties, accessing them might throw an exception (like for
<input type=number>)

*
     * Restores the cursor to its original position after updating the value.
     * @param {string} newValue The value that should be saved.

params.desc: The value that should be saved.

leadingComments.value: _controlStateChanged is abstract, follow-on behaviors may implement it
NOTE(cdata):  if we are in ShadowDOM land, `event.target` will
eventually become `this` due to retargeting; if we are not in
ShadowDOM land, `event.target` will eventually become `this` due
to the second conditional which fires a synthetic event (that is also
handled). In either case, we can disregard `event.path`.
IronControlState stops the focus and blur events in order to redispatch them on the host
element, but paper-input-container listens to those events. Since there are more
pending work on focus/blur in IronControlState, I'm putting in this hack to get the
input focus state working for now.

properties.desc: If `autoValidate` is true, then validates the element.

jsdoc.description: If `autoValidate` is true, then validates the element.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * If `autoValidate` is true, then validates the element.

leadingComments.value: In the Shadow DOM, the `change` event is not leaked into the
ancestor tree, so we must do this manually.
See https://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/shadow/#events-that-are-not-leaked-into-ancestor-trees.

behaviors.desc:
Use `Polymer.PaperInputAddonBehavior` to implement an add-on for `<paper-input-container>`. A
add-on appears below the input, and may display information based on the input value and
validity such as a character counter or an error message.

jsdoc.description:
Use `Polymer.PaperInputAddonBehavior` to implement an add-on for `<paper-input-container>`. A
add-on appears below the input, and may display information based on the input value and
validity such as a character counter or an error message.
jsdoc.orig:
*
   * Use `Polymer.PaperInputAddonBehavior` to implement an add-on for `<paper-input-container>`. A
   * add-on appears below the input, and may display information based on the input value and
   * validity such as a character counter or an error message.
   * @polymerBehavior

paper-input.desc:
`` is a single-line text field with Material Design styling. It may include an optional error message or character counter. It can also include custom prefix or suffix elements, which are displayed before or after the text input itself. In order for an element to be considered as a prefix, it must have the `prefix` attribute (and similarly for `suffix`).
$
 A `paper-input` can use the native `type=search` features. However, since we can't control the native styling of the input, it's recommended to use a placeholder text, or `always-float-label`, as to not overlap the native search icon. See `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` for more API docs. ### Styling See `Polymer.PaperInputContainer` for a list of custom properties used to style this element.

properties.desc:
Set this to specify the pattern allowed by `preventInvalidInput`. Bind this to the
`<input is="iron-input">`'s `allowedPattern` property.

`alwaysFloatLabel` property.

and the input's `invalid` property.

properties.name: required
properties.desc:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recomended to provide a visual style for the element
when it's value is invalid.

properties.name: focused

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc:
True if the input is invalid. This property is set automatically when the input value
changes if auto-validating, or when the `iron-input-validate` event is heard from a child.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable the floating label. The label disappears when the input value is
not null.

properties.name: updateAddons
properties.desc: Call this to update the state of add-ons.

properties.name: _inputHasContent
properties.desc: in polyfill.

paper-input-error.desc:
`<paper-input-error>` is an error message for use with `<paper-input-container>`. The error is
displayed when the `<paper-input-container>` is `invalid`.

    <paper-input-container>
      <input is="iron-input" pattern="[0-9]*">
      <paper-input-error>Only numbers are allowed!</paper-input-error>
    </paper-input-container>

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-input-container-invalid-color` | The foreground color of the error | `--google-red-500`
`--paper-input-error`                   | Mixin applied to the error        | `{}`

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc: True if the error is showing.

paper-input-char-counter.desc:
`<paper-input-char-counter>` is a character counter for use with `<paper-input-container>`. It
shows the number of characters entered in the input and the max length if it is specified.

    <paper-input-container>
      <input is="iron-input" maxlength="20">
      <paper-input-char-counter></paper-input-char-counter>
    </paper-input-container>

### Styling

The following mixin is available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-input-char-counter` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`

paper-textarea.desc:
`<paper-textarea>` is a multi-line text field with Material Design styling.

    <paper-textarea label="Textarea label"></paper-textarea>

See `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` for more API docs.

### Validation

Currently only `required` and `maxlength` validation is supported.

### Styling

See `Polymer.PaperInputContainer` for a list of custom properties used to
style this element.

properties.desc:
Name of the validator to use. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `validator`
property.

properties.name: value
properties.desc:
The value for this input. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `bindValue`
property, or the value property of your input that is `notify:true`.

properties.name: _handleAutoValidate
properties.desc: If `autoValidate` is true, then validates the element.
